intro: Erucastrum latirostre, commonly known as broad-nosed erucoid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as broccoli and mustard. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers are yellowish-green with four petals, and the plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds.
